doc:
Doris Houck https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Doris_Houck 0 Doris Houck (September 28, 1921 – December 14, 1965) was an American film actress. She appeared in 25 films from 1932 to 1955. Houck was the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Geoge Houck. She is familiar to modern viewers for her roles in several Three Stooges short subjects, such as G.I. Wanna Home. She is best remembered as the aggressive girlfriend who throws Shemp Howard's head into a vise until he decided to marry her in Brideless Groom:
Shemp: "Stop, I'm getting a headache!" Houck: "I'll fix your headache!"Houck was married to oil man Edward G. Nealis; they divorced in May 1948. On January 6, 1950, Houck married Fred Otash, a Los Angeles police officer, in Beverly Hills. They were divorced on June 19, 1952.Houck died suddenly on December 14, 1965. Doris_Houck ( September_28_,_1921 – December_14_,_1965 ) was an_American_film_actress . She appeared in 25_films from 1932 to 1955 . Houck was the_daughter of Mr._and_Mrs._Geoge_Houck . She is familiar to modern_viewers for her_roles in several_Three_Stooges short_subjects , such_as G.I._Wan na Home . She is_best_remembered as the_aggressive_girlfriend who throws Shemp_Howard 's_head into a_vise until he decided_to_marry her in Brideless_Groom : Shemp : " Stop , I 'm_getting a_headache ! " Houck : " I 'll_fix your_headache ! " Houck was_married to oil_man_Edward_G._Nealis ; they divorced in May_1948 . On January_6_,_1950 , Houck married Fred_Otash , a_Los_Angeles_police_officer , in Beverly_Hills . They were_divorced on June_19_,_1952 . Houck died suddenly on December_14_,_1965 .
